xxl.cursors
Class SortMerge

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.cursors.BufferedCursor
        |
        +--xxl.cursors.SortMerge
Direct Known Subclasses:
Orenstein
public abstract class SortMerge
extends BufferedCursor
implements Join

This class provides a lazy SortMerge-Join implementation for two cursors.

Constructor Detail

SortMerge

public SortMerge(Cursor sortedInput0,
                 Cursor sortedInput1,
                 SortMerge.SweepArea sweepArea0,
                 SortMerge.SweepArea sweepArea1,
                 Heap heap,
                 Function newResult)
Creates a new SortMerge-Join with lazy evaluation backed on two sorted Cursors.
Two SweepAreas are used to store each Cursor's elements during the merging phase of the two input-Cursors. To coordinate the iteration of the two sorted input-Cursors a a Heap is used, that should be initialized with the two input-Cursors.
Furthermore a function can be specified that is invoked on each qualifying tuple before it is returned to the caller concerning a call to next(). This function is a kind of factory-method to model the resulting object.
Parameters:
sortedInput0 - the first sorted input-Cursor.
sortedInput1 - the secont sorted input-Cursor.
sweepArea0 - a SweepArea that contains the elements of then input-Cursor sortedInput0.
sweepArea1 - a SweepArea that contains the elements of then input-Cursor sortedInput1.
heap - a Heap of Cursors used to coordinate the iteration of the two sorted input-Cursors; it should be initialized with the two input-Cursors.
newResult - a factory-method (Function) that takes two parameters as argument an is invoked on each tuple where the predicate's evaluation result is true, i.e. on each qualifying tuple before it is returned to the caller concerning a call to next().

SortMerge

public SortMerge(Cursor sortedInput,
                 SortMerge.SweepArea sweepArea,
                 Function newResult)
Creates a new SortMerge-Join with lazy evaluation backed on one sorted Cursor (Sort-"Sweep" for one data set (self-join)).
A SweepArea is used to store the Cursor's elements during the merging phase.
Furthermore a function can be specified that is invoked on each qualifying tuple before it is returned to the caller concerning a call to next(). This function is a kind of factory-method to model the resulting object.
Parameters:
sortedInput - the sorted input-Cursor.
sweepArea - a SweepArea that contains the elements of then input-Cursor.
newResult - a factory-method (Function) that takes two parameters as argument an is invoked on each tuple where the predicate's evaluation result is true, i.e. on each qualifying tuple before it is returned to the caller concerning a call to next().

SortMerge

public SortMerge(Cursor sortedInput0,
                 Cursor sortedInput1,
                 SortMerge.SweepArea sweepArea0,
                 SortMerge.SweepArea sweepArea1,
                 Comparator comparator,
                 Function newResult)
Creates a new SortMerge-Join with lazy evaluation backed on two sorted Cursors.
Two SweepAreas are used to store each Cursor's elements during the merging phase of the two input-Cursors. To coordinate the iteration of the two sorted input-Cursors a a Heap is created by default and initialized with the two input-Cursors. The Heap's order is defined by comparing the peek-elements of the two input-Cursors using the given comparator.
Furthermore a function can be specified that is invoked on each qualifying tuple before it is returned to the caller concerning a call to next(). This function is a kind of factory-method to model the resulting object.
Parameters:
sortedInput0 - the first sorted input-Cursor.
sortedInput1 - the secont sorted input-Cursor.
sweepArea0 - a SweepArea that contains the elements of then input-Cursor sortedInput0.
sweepArea1 - a SweepArea that contains the elements of then input-Cursor sortedInput1.
comparator - a Comparator used to define the order of internally used heap. It is applied on the two peek-elements of the input-Cursors.
newResult - a factory-method (Function) that takes two parameters as argument an is invoked on each tuple where the predicate's evaluation result is true, i.e. on each qualifying tuple before it is returned to the caller concerning a call to next().

SortMerge

public SortMerge(Cursor sortedInput0,
                 Cursor sortedInput1,
                 SortMerge.SweepArea sweepArea0,
                 SortMerge.SweepArea sweepArea1,
                 Function newResult)
Creates a new SortMerge-Join with lazy evaluation backed on two sorted Cursors.
Two SweepAreas are used to store each Cursor's elements during the merging phase of the two input-Cursors. To coordinate the iteration of the two sorted input-Cursors a a Heap is created by default and initialized with the two input-Cursors. The Heap's order is defined by comparing the peek-elements of the two input-Cursors using the a ComparableComparator.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.
Furthermore a function can be specified that is invoked on each qualifying tuple before it is returned to the caller concerning a call to next(). This function is a kind of factory-method to model the resulting object.
Parameters:
sortedInput0 - the first sorted input-Cursor.
sortedInput1 - the secont sorted input-Cursor.
sweepArea0 - a SweepArea that contains the elements of then input-Cursor sortedInput0.
sweepArea1 - a SweepArea that contains the elements of then input-Cursor sortedInput1.
newResult - a factory-method (Function) that takes two parameters as argument an is invoked on each tuple where the predicate's evaluation result is true, i.e. on each qualifying tuple before it is returned to the caller concerning a call to next().

SortMerge

public SortMerge(Cursor input0,
                 Cursor input1,
                 SortMerge.SweepArea sweepArea0,
                 SortMerge.SweepArea sweepArea1,
                 Function newSorter0,
                 Function newSorter1,
                 Function newResult)
Creates a new SortMerge-Join with lazy evaluation backed on two unsorted Cursors.
A function has to be defined that is invoked on each input-Cursor to this Cursor sorted. Two SweepAreas are used to store each Cursor's elements during the merging phase of the two input-Cursors. To coordinate the iteration of the two sorted input-Cursors a a Heap is created by default and initialized with the two input-Cursors. The Heap's order is defined by comparing the peek-elements of the two input-Cursors using the a ComparableComparator.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.
Furthermore a function can be specified that is invoked on each qualifying tuple before it is returned to the caller concerning a call to next(). This function is a kind of factory-method to model the resulting object.
Parameters:
input0 - the first sorted input-Cursor.
input1 - the secont sorted input-Cursor.
sweepArea0 - a SweepArea that contains the elements of then input-Cursor sortedInput0.
sweepArea1 - a SweepArea that contains the elements of then input-Cursor sortedInput1.
newSorter0 - a Function applied on input-Cursor input0 that should return a sorted Cursor.
new - Sorter1 a Function applied on input-Cursor input1 that should return a sorted Cursor.
newResult - a factory-method (Function) that takes two parameters as argument an is invoked on each tuple where the predicate's evaluation result is true, i.e. on each qualifying tuple before it is returned to the caller concerning a call to next().

SortMerge

                 Cursor input1,

                 SortMerge.SweepArea sweepArea1,
                 Function newSorter0,

Linearizes the input to a Sort-Merge Join. (makes sense before sorting)
